The Maeander, now known as the Menderes, 584 km. in length, flows through a narrow valley and a canyon, in a west-south-westerly direction from its source in the Anatolian plateau. I estimate that the Biiyiik Menderes Nehri, the modern Turkish name of the Maeander, now has a river valley of about 140 kilometres in length, and in places exceeds fifteen kilometres in width

The forbidding country, the shortage of water and the difficulty of the terrain account for the route of the Royal Road, and are the main reasons why the Eastern war lords Cyrus, Darius and Xerxes took the less arduous northern route
